thread.title: ‘Parting gift’: Chicago, Los Angeles receive BILLIONS in transportation funding from Pres. Obama
thread.title_full: ‘Parting gift’: Chicago, Los Angeles receive BILLIONS in transportation funding from Pres. Obama

author: Greg P.
title: ‘Parting gift’: Chicago, Los Angeles receive BILLIONS in transportation funding from Pres. Obama
text:
— John Pletz (@johnpletz) January 8, 2017 
Imagine if Donald Trump had proposed billions of dollars in new infrastructure spending that only benefits voters in rosy-red states? There’d be an outcry, right? 
But when President Obama does it with mere weeks left in his term, it’s crickets. 
Chicago is set to receive $1.1 billion for the Red Line elevated train… BREAKING >> @CTA lands $1.1 billion goodbye grant from #Obama for North Side Red Line work https://t.co/9DSBdlrDs9 pic.twitter.com/kelXY5I5oD 
— Crain's Chicago (@CrainsChicago) January 8, 2017 
…while Los Angeles got $1.6 billion for its subway: Celebrating $1.6 billion in @USDOT funding for Sec. 2 of @metrolosangeles Purple Line Extension to Century City! https://t.co/ihePDjMbB2 pic.twitter.com/ZzncspP0tW 
— Kristin Slocum (@Mobility21) January 5, 2017 
Ka. Ching.
